title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Tuesday, 8 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .
man arrested over death of inmate at peterborough prison .
stagecoach 'unable ' to reach agreement with abellio on rail franchise bid .
call for action to prevent genetic disorders from cousin marriage .

documents.title: that 's all from cambridgeshire live for today
text: we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 with the latest news , sport , travel and weather in the county .
you can send us your stories and
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : it will become clear and cold tonight
text: locally heavy rain should die away before midnight .
the rest of the night will then be dry with clear spells .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
tomorrow will be fine and dry but with a chilly start to the day .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: police appeal for witnesses to 'cowardly ' attempted armed robbery
text: police have appealed for witnesses to a `` cowardly '' attempted armed robbery on a refuse worker in little paxton .
he was approached by two men at 07:45 on 4 december .
one of them then pulled a bladed weapon and demanded money .
pc james lee says the incident has left the man `` shaken '' and is urging anyone to come forward .
author: Kerry Devine
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: man arrested on sus of rape in haddenham
text: police have stepped-up patrols in haddenham after reports of a teenage girl being raped .
a 43-year-old man from haddenham was arrested on sus of rape last friday and is due to answer bail this saturday .
det ch insp donna wass said : `` we have dedicated resources to provide an increased reassurance to both the victim and community '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : police increase patrols following reports of serious sexual assault outline planning permission granted to £ 120m peterborough redevelopment
text: if you are just joining us , here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car leaves the road and plunges into water at sixteen foot bank
text: police have tweeted this image of a car that left the road on the b1098 , sixteen foot bank , and plunged into water .
officers say the driver was unhurt .
sixteen foot bank is an isolated road in the middle of the fens between chatteris and upwell .
it runs alongside the sixteen foot drain - one of the network of drainage channels in the fens .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fa cup : peterborough 's third round draw against preston is 'winnable '
text: peterborough united manager graham westley says their next fa cup round tie against championship side preston north end is `` winnable '' .
the posh boss told bbc radio cambridgeshire : `` it 's at our place , and in the end that 's what you want in a draw '' .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: horsing around : rosie the horse gets in the christmas spirit
text: even rosie the horse has got into the festive spirit at willow house in turves , which is hosting what is thought to be the largest christmas display in east anglia .
robert and amanda dempsey have decorated their two-acre property with over one million christmas lights and decorations .
you can send us your festive
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: peterborough councillors grant outline planning approval to £ 120m fletton quay redevelopment
text: councillors in peterborough have unanimously granted outline planning approval to the £ 120m redevelopment of fletton quays .
plans for the 20-acre derelict site include hundreds of new homes , offices , restaurants and a hotel .
author: Kerry Devine
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: peterborough mp calls for 'proper debate ' on lowering voting age
text: peterborough mp stewart jackson has called for a `` proper debate '' after mps rejected lowering the voting age to 16 in the referendum on britain 's eu membership .
the house of lords had amended the eu referendum bill to lower the voting age , but the proposal was rejected after a short debate in the commons .
conservative stewart jackson said he voted against the proposal , adding that mps need a proper chance to discuss giving the vote to under-18s .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: man sentenced to five years in prison for cambridge rape
text: a man has been sentenced to five years in prison for raping a 17-year-old woman in cambridge .
emmanuel malunga , 29 , of hazelwood close , cambridge , met the victim during an evening out at cambridge leisure park .
the pair , along with others , went back to a property in ware road where the rape took place in the early hours of 16 july 2014 .
malunga was found guilty of rape following a trial at cambridge crown court in october .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : lorry driver dies following m11 crash refuse worker threatened with knife
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Kerry Devine
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: campaigners call on planners to defer decision on 'bland ' fletton quays development
text: `` bland '' development plans for a 20-acre derelict site in peterborough should be deferred , say campaigners .
the £ 120m redevelopment plans for fletton quays could be granted outline planning permission by councillors this afternoon .
but peterborough civic society says the proposals - which include luxury apartments , restaurants and new offices - `` lack vision '' .
author: Kerry Devine
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cambridge people pledge support for arriving refugees
text: people and businesses have stepped up to pledge their support after cambridge welcomed its first refugees from syria .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: video : 'i 've always been one of those people who had a few lights out '
text: `` i 've always been one of those people who had a few lights out , '' says robert dempsey , after covering his two-acre property in the fens with christmas decorations .
robert was inspired to put on the ambitious display at his turves home to raise money for cancer research uk , following the death of his mother .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: refuse worker threatened with knife in attempted robbery
text: a council refuse worker has been threatened with a knife in an attempted robbery in little paxton .
police say two men approached the district council employee at the junction of park avenue and park drive .
one of the men then pulled a bladed weapon and demanded money .
they are described as being of asian appearance and aged between 18 and 20 .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lorry driver dies following m11 crash
text: a man has died following a crash between two lorries on the m11 last week .
paul fallowes , 45 , of duck lane , haddenham , was taken to hospital after the lorry he was driving crashed with another hgv near madingley on 1 december .
in a statement his family said : `` paul 's death is a tragedy and a massive loss .
it will leave a huge hole in all of our lives '' .
author: Kerry Devine
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'exceptional contribution ' of young carer recognised by queen
text: a young carer from cambridge who looks after her mother and 12-year-old brother is to receive an award from the queen , recognising her `` exceptional contribution to the community '' .
ella mckenzie ( left ) is being given the queen 's young leadership award - one of just 60 young people from across the commonwealth to receive the award .
the 20-year-old has been caring for her mother - who has the rheumatic condition fibromyalgia - since she was 15 .
author: Katharine Park
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : breezy with a few showers this afternoon
text: it will be bright and breezy for most this afternoon with just a few showers .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: death still being treated as 'unexplained ' after body found in peterborough
text: police have told us the death of a man whose body was found in water in peterborough yesterday is still being treated as unexplained .
as reported in the peterborough telegraph , officers were called at 13:45 by a member of the public reporting a body in the river near mancetter square .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: chancellor tells mp lucy frazer he will 'look closely ' at her bid for upgrades to the a10
text: george osborne has told mp lucy frazer that he will `` look closely '' at her bid for the a10 betweenely and cambridge to be upgraded .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: travel : a141 closed between chatteris and wimblington following accident involving a lorry
text: the a141 between chatteris and wimblington remains closed following an accident involving a lorry .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: turves couple claim to have largest christmas lights display in east anglia
text: robert and amanda dempsey from turves think their one million bulb christmas light display is the biggest in east anglia - can you beat it ?
the couple first adorned their two-acre fenland property with lights last year to raise money for cancer research .
it has proved so popular that this year they 've had to open a car park for visitors .
you can send us your
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : family pays tribute to cyclist who died following collision with coach new uniformed council team to tackle anti-social behaviour in peterborough
text: here are the main stories in cambridgeshire so far today :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: new uniformed team will tackle anti-social behaviour 'more efficiently '
text: new uniformed teams will be able to deal with anti-social behaviour in peterborough `` more efficiently , '' say police .
workers at peterborough city council will be brought together to create a new safety and enforcement team , to tackle things like street begging , fly-tipping and illegal cycling .
ch insp robbin sissons says they will not be able to make arrests but will be issued with radios , so if there is a problem `` police will be right beside them '' .
they will begin patrols in april .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: family pays tribute to cyclist killed in crash with coach
text: the family of a cyclist who died following a crash with a coach in cambridge last week have paid tribute to her .
jane herbert , 61 , of latham road , was cycling on trumpington road when she was struck last wednesday .
her husband dr andrew herbert , obe , the retired head of microsoft research cambridge , and her three children say she will be `` sadly missed '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fa cup : peterborough united to play preston north end in third round
text: peterborough united will host preston north end in the third round of the fa cup , following last night 's draw .
that tie will take place in january .
for the full list of fa cup third round ties head to bbc sport .
author: Nick Fairbairn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: cambridgeshire couple light up the fens with one million christmas lights
text: a cambridgeshire couple have used about one million bulbs to create what they believe is the biggest display of christmas lights in east anglia at their two-acre fenland property .
robert and amanda dempsey started decorating their home in the village of turves for the first time last year to raise money for cancer research uk .
it has taken them a whole month to set up .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: new uniformed team to tackle anti-social behaviour in peterborough
text: council workers are being given more powers to tackle anti-social behaviour in peterborough .
new uniformed safety and enforcement teams will be able to issue tickets for things like street begging , fly-tipping and illegal cycling - but will not have the police 's power of arrest .
councillors gave them the go-ahead yesterday and the enforcement staff will be be visible on the streets from april .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: government should look to 'professors of bletchley park ' and let academics shape defence policy
text: university scholars should have a greater say in shaping national security policy , a cambridge academic has claimed .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: headlines : new team set up to tackle anti-social behaviour in peterborough campaigners call for 'bland ' development to be deferred
text: here are the headlines for cambridgeshire :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : breezy with rain , followed by scattered showers
text: rain will quickly clear away to the east this morning , leaving the rest of the day brighter with a small chance of a shower .
it 'll feel colder than of late in the breeze .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: Sara Thornton
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : accident involving a car and a motorbike on the a1198 at graveley
text: accident involving a car and a motorbike on the a1198 at graveley - expect delays .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to cambridgeshire live on tuesday
text: we 'll be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , travel and weather in the county .
